dialogues.text: This isn't cool. If I have to drive, you have to talk to me. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's how this ride-sharing thing works. Division of labor. We split everything fifty-fifty... Get it? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got news for you, I don't get much more entertaining than when I'm on the phone. He darkens, mutters under his breath: GUY (sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it. They ride in silence for a moment. She tries to strike up conversation, by way of extending an olive branch.

dialogues.text: So you're from Wilmington, huh? GUY

dialogues.text: Um... Saint Vitus Academy. GIRL

dialogues.text: St. Vitus? You're making that up. GUY

dialogues.text: You're acquainted with every school in the area? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Including all the Catholic ones? Because that's where I went. Saint Vitus Academy for Catholic Boys. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Why would you assume anything about me? We just met. GUY (a little defensive)

dialogues.text: Someone ran us off the road. He shines the flashlight directly in our girl's eyes. HIGHWAY PATROLMAN

dialogues.text: There's no parking here. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? We're not parking here. Didn't you hear what she said? Someone ran us off-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: HIGHWAY PATROLMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Of course I might be willing to let you off with a warning this time... if we can come to some sort of arrangement... GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking ab- The girl, quicker to catch on than the guy, puts a hand o his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a shake-down. He's probably partners with the guy who ran us off the road. Wouldn't be surprised if he has a deal with the tow guy, too. He turns to her, says in an angry whisper - GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this whole thing was a scam? Jesus, he could've killed us! But she's already digging cash out of her purse. GIRL (fierce whisper)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much cash do you have on you? He looks at her in disbelief. Sees that she's serious. He digs out his wallet, starts to climb over her to exit. Sh stops him. GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many speeding tickets have you sweet-talked your way out of? He concedes her point silently. She plucks the money from hand. Opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She exits the stranded car into the frigid cold. The cop waits, facing away, in the spotlight-like glare o his IDLING PATROL CAR's headlights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                   5

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She walks back toward him, finds him mopping the back of neck with a handkerchief. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is all we have. HIGHWAY PATROLMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some weather we're having... GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's really coming down. (indicating the money)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you say? How `bout a little Christmas spirit here? HIGHWAY PATROLMAN (still facing away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this is one bad stretch of road. All kinds of trouble going on up here: Kids drag racing. Niggers hauling booze across the state lines. Lady drivers breaking down, no-one ever hears from them again... Her bravado begins to flag. This isn't the kind of police officer she's used to dealing with. She glances worriedly back in the direction of the Olds. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We just want to get out of here, so if you could just- She holds out the money, but he ignores it. HIGHWAY PATROLMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me tell you, I've seen a lot of fatalities on this road... He takes off his hat so he can mop his brow. As he turns, she gets a first good look at his face: handsome but hard with cruel snake charmer's eyes looking back at her... HIGHWAY PATROLMAN (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're lucky I came along when I did. So why don't we get in my car... She's scared now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She looks past him to where the HIGHWAY PATROL car sits idling in a red plume of exhaust fumes. GIRL (backing away)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think maybe I just want to go back- HIGHWAY PATROLMAN

dialogues.speaker: YOU'RE NOT GOING ANYWHERE
dialogues.text: She startles as if slapped, too horrified to parse his meaning. She continues backing away until she's backed up against trunk of the Olds. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No... The cop is advancing toward her when suddenly he catches sight of something high on the hillside behind her that m him stop. She glances over her shoulder to see what he's looking at A LIGHT on the hilltop, where the burned-out ruins stand. And weirder still, there's a FIGURE in silhouette standin nearby. Someone watching. The cop darkens, enraged by this unwanted audience. His f contorts, fury building in him until he trembles with it. rests his hand on the butt of his service revolver, says her in a low urgent voice: HIGHWAY PATROLMAN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get in the damn patrol car... She starts walking toward the parked patrol car ahead of The highway patrolman's boots CRUNCHING behind her. The patrol car's HEADLIGHTS are blinding. She moves towar them, squinting, as if moving down a tunnel of light. GIRL (terrified; beginning to cry)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please... just let us go...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hurry up...we've got an audience...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (begging)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we didn't do anything! Please! We won't tell anybody if you let us-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get away from her you bastard! Suddenly the guy appears brandishing a CROWBAR. He swings it in a lethal arc toward the patrolman's head. The cop's head crumples inward. The cop's expression of F suddenly STUTTERS, like film slipping in the projector - As two worlds that should never intersect, do, violently For an instant, the cop's face appears...charred. Like a human face projected onto a scorched and melting balloon. The image flickers - And on an ear-splitting HOWL we -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, jarringly, the kids are seated BACK INSIDE THE As if someone hit RESET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stunned)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What just... out there...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (unsure)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it did happen, right? Or not... Our guy winces in pain.     TILT DOWN to reveal:

dialogues.speaker: HIS HANDS
dialogues.text: Frostbitten, still clutching the crowbar. She tries to ta it out of his bloody, blackened hands and he GASPS in ago

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus.    OK. Hold on. She pours water from a plastic bottle over his palms to t and break the seal between the fused skin and metal. GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.text: OK, hold on, this is going to hurt.

dialogues.text: Do it. She fights her own gag reflex as she pulls the crowbar fr It comes away with several long black strips of dead skin still attached. His palms are bloody pulps. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How bad? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frostbite, second and third-degree. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know? You take a first aid course or something? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ski camp, seventh grade... (off his look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't make fun. What else do you have going on when you're thirteen? She stretches herself out alongside him in the back seat. Tugs up her layers of sweaters to expose her stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kinda not in the mood anymore. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to rewarm your hands. You have ice crystals in your blood. If we don't get circulation restored you could lose your fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She takes his frostbitten hands and gingerly as possible presses them against the warm skin of her belly, rewarmin them. They lie there in silence for a beat, faces inches apart. GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What just happened to us out there? GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean? You were there. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but who was he? Where'd he go? It's like one minute there's a, a gun to my head and the next all the lights go out and he's gone, like a, like a- GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ghost. Her eyes cut to his, afraid, resistent to the very idea. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. And the old guys we chased- GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What then? How do you explain- GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know! This is crazy! I can't be having this conversation. GUY (forceful)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're having it. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to! GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I do?! Jesus. I'm just as freaked by what's happening as you. But we have to deal with it, `cause like it or not, it is happening...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then how do we make it stop? GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. They don't cover this in Philosophy 101. GIRL (casting for ideas)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about that book, in the back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What book? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something Book of the Dead. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tibetan. It's not a How-to manual. It's an 8th century Buddhist guide on death and dying. GIRL (despairing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God. Why is this happening to us? He doesn't have an answer.    They fall silent for a beat GUY (hands on her belly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can feel your stomach rumbling. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. God, I'd give anything for some of those Carr's crackers right now... Trying to take their minds off the grim situation. GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what else was in the grocery bag I forgot? GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, let's see. Duck liver pat with truffles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  65

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some olives, the normal kind and also some of the little shrivelled black ones. A bottle of white wine...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmmmm... GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And for dessert, anisette biscotti and a thermos of espresso. GIRL (ecstacy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohhhh... She closes her eyes, imagining the meal that might've bee GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's pretty much the exact meal I'd order for my last day on earth. I swear to god, if we ever get out of here I'm going to have to get a restraining order against- If they ever get out of here. Her eyes brim, tears spilli down her cheeks. He tries to sound optimistic. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't be too much longer until dawn. Someone's bound to come along then. A snowplow or something. Right? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How are your hands? GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Starting to burn... GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's good. It means the circulation's coming back. GUY (winces)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but I mean really burn... GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang on. I think I have a few Tylenol-with-codeine in my purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  66

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She climbs into the front seat and searches through her p for the prescription bottle. With the poor light and with her contacts she has trouble finding it. She takes out he glasses and, a little embarrassed, slips them on. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's taking so long, nurse -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just- She's about to climb back when something catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The one used to patch the small gap in the passenger wind There's a faded PHOTOGRAPH of a group of ELDERLY PRIESTS gathered around a MANGLED `55 FORD CROWN VIC. dialogues.text: Oh my god. I think I know who our old guys are... I mean, were... Below the accident scene photo are HIGH SCHOOL YEARBOOK PORTRAITS of TWO TEENAGE BOYS with crewcuts and letter jackets bearing a distinctive team insignia "The Cougars. dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... first to arrive at the scene were Roman Catholic priests from St. Christopher's Home for Retired Clergy... "

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Priests! Suddenly, the interior light fizzles out, making her jump She reaches up and taps on it until it flickers back on.

dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.text: "... Hearing the crash on nearby Route 606, they braved inclement weather to administer Last Rights..." GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That must be what we saw them doing! She skim-reads ahead, trying to glean more information. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "... also killed was State Highway Patrolman... continued on page seven." She tears the brittle top pages of the newspaper away. Finds there is no page seven. GUY (gritted teeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got that Tylenol?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coming. She climbs over into the back seat, feeds him two of the Tylenol with a sip of water from a bottle. Then stretches out alongside him again. GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We should take turns keeping watch. In case he comes back. GUY (eyelids heavy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll go first. You get some sleep. He drifts off to sleep.

BRENDA LEE

dialogues.text: Which is when a gloved fist PUNCHES THROUGH THE WINDOW an hauls her kicking and screaming out of the Oldsmobile...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And our girl finally surfaces from the dream as if coming for air, with a huge GASP and eyes wild with fear. Only t find herself in a waking nightmare. The car interior flooded with red.    Our guy terrified. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's happening!? GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him! Hurry! Help me! She climbs up front to help our guy frantically taping ov the vents. A shadow moves by the WINDSHIELD and she gasps As another shadow goes by in a blur past the BACK WINDOW he gasps- The assault coming from everywhere at once now, the cop a elemental force, like the storm itself. Skittering along undercarriage one moment, across the metal roof the next. Even appearing -- fleetingly, impossibly -- in the snow o the blocked driver's side window. All the electronics in the car start going crazy, power l opening and closing, the interior light flickering, the dashboard clock hands spinning wildly, the windshield wip sweeping back and forth, etc. Then stop all at once. Even the radio SNAPS OFF. Dead silence for a beat. Then an odd SCUTTLING SOUND underfoot, something crawling along the undercarriage of the car. Our guy sits there frozen with fear, too scared to move, even breathe. Likewise, the girl sits nervously, watching her breath in cold. Her eyes happen to wander to the rear view mirror- A blue-faced DEAD BABY stares back at her from the rear window ledge. She SWINGS around, looks back at the window.   But nothin there.

dialogues.text: He's not! Listen! They sit in silence, listening, but hear only the wind. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if he comes back..? GUY

dialogues.text: We just have to stay in the car until morning. Then we'll be safe. That can't be more than, like, a few more hours... Someone's bound to come along once the sun comes up... Someone human I mean. Think you can hold on until then? GIRL (shy)

dialogues.text: What if, you know. We have to pee? GUY

dialogues.text: We can use the empty water bottles. From this point on, the back seat is a co-ed bathroom. Sound like a plan? Sounds like a plan. GUY (cont'd)

dialogues.text: I'm serious! It's hard enough doing this in front of you.

dialogues.text: What, are you one of those people who can't pee with the bathroom door open?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. But it's not something I usually do until much later in a relationship...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She catches herself at the last second, but it's too late the word "relationship" hangs in the air. Beat. Finished peeing, she twists the cap on the water bottle. Sets it on the floor with the other URINE-FILLED BOTTLES. Noticing ONE BOTTLE that doesn't look like the others. She climbs over into the front to confront him with the u bottle, which is tinged with PINK. Blood. GIRL (cont'd) What the hell is this? Is this blood?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer. GIRL (cont'd) How badly were you hurt in the crash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shrugs) No big deal. Just your average day in the NHL...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But she sees through his tough-guy facade.       He's fri

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How long have you known?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since I tried hiking back to the gas station. You were right, I never got anywhere near it. I

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                 76A

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GUY (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: started hurling blood, so I turned around and came back. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why didn't you tell me? GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want to scare you-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Suddenly he goes rigid in pain, his teeth clenched.   She looks on helplessly. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to get you some help now. You won't make it to morning. I'm going to try and hike back to the gas station- GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How far do you think you'd get out there before running into Mr. Freeze? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to just sit here and watch you die! They sit there a moment in silence. She digs out her cellphone and checks for a signal: NO SIGNAL BARS. GIRL (cont'd) (to herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn it! We need a land line ... A long beat. Then she's struck by an idea. She switches on the wipers to clear snow from the windshi Wipes at the foggy glass until she's got enough of a peep to peek out. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you looking at? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Telephone poles. They must have a junction box or something to test the lines ... There! See that one? She indicates a TELEPHONE POLE twenty yards up from them. There's a SMALL GREY STEEL JUNCTION BOX near the top. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? She turns, leaning over the seatback to rummage among his junk in the back. She retrieves his old wall TELEPHONE, examines the jack at end of its cord.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So maybe there's some way I can... I don't know... jack into it or something. Try and call for help. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to climb a telephone pole? GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I don't want to! But it's got rungs. Can't be any harder than the climbing wall at my gym. Big fat repair guys do it all the time, right? Right? Trying to convince herself. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're forgetting one thing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's out there. They both go quiet. She sits there with the phone in her lap, brooding on thi Until something clicks. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song! That old Christmas song on the radio. It always comes on just before he shows up... She switches on the RADIO. They hear Elvis Presley's 1957 "Blue Christmas" playing. GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep listening. If `Rockin' Around the Christmas Tree' comes on, yell like hell. (trying to convince herself)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hopefully I'll have enough time to get back. WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  79

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: Looking down at the stranded Oldsmobile from the top of t telephone pole. The grey JUNCTION BOX in the foreground. The weird HUMMING is louder here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He watches her prep for her mission out into the bitter c She disconnects the TELEPHONE RECEIVER from it's base, wr it in its chord, stows it for safekeeping under her sweat She's ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (weak)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been thinking... GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about? GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eternal recurrence. Maybe it wouldn't be so bad. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What wouldn't? GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Repeating this life. Over and over. Exactly the same each time. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even the last twenty-four hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He shows a weak smile.   Even the last twenty four hours. GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's even nicer to think maybe we get a chance to fix all the things we screwed up the first time around, don't you think? They fall silent, both thinking about this. GUY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Know what I'd do different? Next time I'd just to walk up to you after class... and say "Hey." GIRL (smiles)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should. Definitely. Do that. She uses her sweater cuff to make clean spot on his cheek Kisses him tenderly. The kiss working it's way to his mouth, lingering a beat. Their lips part. He catches her arm as she reaches for the power window switch, holds tight. GUY (urgently)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me die out here- She looks at him with fierce eyes full of determination. look calms him, at least a little. She keys the ignition, lowers the passenger side window. The duct tape rips away as the window glides down, admitt a mini-avalanche of powdery snow and a frigid blast of co She climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Viewed from high atop the telephone pole she looks small vulnerable as she climbs out of the Oldsmobile-shaped igl WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An eerie HUSH has fallen, snow muffling sound except for occasional forlorn wailing of the WIND through the trees. She sets out through deep powder toward the TELEPHONE POL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Teeth chattering, he watches through the windshield as sh begins her long trek across the MOONLIT EXPANSE OF WHITE. He turns up the VOLUME on the radio, which is now playing funereal church-organ instrumental of "Silent Night."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The deep powder makes her trek difficult, and she's soon winded. Her breath plumes in the frigid arctic cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE BACKLIT RADIO DIAL as "Silent Night" conclud In between STATIC we hear a pre-recorded PUBLIC SERVICE ANNOUNCEMENT. RADIO PSA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The State Weather Bureau has issued an extreme cold warning...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She leans into the wind as it gusts, the cold bringing te to her eyes. She puts her head down and soldiers on. RADIO PSA (O.S.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Residents of Carbon County are advised to seek shelter as sub-zero temperatures produce wind chills in excess of twenty below...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arriving at the base of the telephone pole, she peers up the grey JUNCTION BOX high above. From here the top of th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                   8

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: telephone pole looks much higher than it did from the car And the iron rungs look a lot narrower, too. She's losing her nerve. She glances back to check no police lights are coming. Steels herself. Then puts her foot on the first rung and hauls herself up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE RADIO, where, between increasingly long snat of STATIC we can just discern Gene Autry's version of "He Comes Santa Claus."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The rungs are icy, forcing her to climb slower than she w like. She keeps her eyes forward, never once looking down When the wind gusts she pauses and waits for it to subsid She's midway to the top when her foot SLIPS on an icy run She clutches the pole tightly, wind whistling in her ears She waits until her heart slows and she's recovered from near fall. Then looks up to gauge the distance left to the JUNCTION Keeps climbing. She reaches the last rung at the TOP OF THE TELEPHONE POL It's noisy up here, thanks to the WIND and the icy teleph wires, source of the mysterious HUMMING she's been hearin She tries the little metal door of the grey JUNCTION BOX. Locked. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!! She fumbles in her coat, takes out the SCISSORS, uses the try and pry open the junction box (which turns out to be frozen shut, not locked after all.) It finally yields, opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Revealing a rat's nest of multicolored WIRES and PHONE JA Hurrying now, she tugs her glove off with her teeth, and her bare hand retrieves the cord-wrapped RECEIVER from in her sweater. In her effort to juggle all these items she loses her grip on the SCISSORS... Which drop all the   way down to disappear in the snow be She concentrates now on the receiver.    But her fingers clumsy from the cold, she fumbles it. And the receiver FALLS too. Then jerks to a STOP a few feet below as it reaches the l of its cord. Which she's managed to catch. She winds the receiver up b its cord, finally plugs the jack-end into the junction bo Hears a DIAL TONE. GIRL (cont'd) (stunned she did it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god! Teeth chattering she thumbs "0" for the operator. GIRL (cont'd) (as it rings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please please please please please- On the third ring an OPERATOR answers. OPERATOR (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine-one-one emergency response. GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank god! Hi! Hello! We need help! OPERATOR (filtered)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that? Can you repeat- GIRL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're on highway 606! Oh god, please hurry! We need help! My friend is hurt- OPERATOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you repeat your-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GIRL

dialogues.text: Hello? Hello? The connection SPARKS and she feels a small shock that ma her drop the phone. When she retrieves it and holds it ba to her ear the line is DEAD. No way of knowing if her message got through. It's a moment of such soul-crushing despair she shuts her eyes and leans her head against the pole, as if wanting t just quietly die up here thirty feet above the earth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE RADIO playing nothing but STATIC now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes open, and she commences climbing back down to ea She reaches the second set of rungs from the bottom and d the last several feet. The snow does little to cushion he fall and she goes sprawling, lays there for a dazed momen She starts crawling on all fours back toward the stranded Olds. Suddenly she stops as she comes upon-

dialogues.speaker: A WOMAN'S BARE FEET
dialogues.text: standing in the snow, veins visible through gravid skin. A thick spatter of mud lands on the bare foot. Our girl raises her eyes to see -

dialogues.speaker: A DEAD WOMAN
dialogues.text: It's the blonde we saw raped and murdered in the summer o 1958. Her dress is in tattered ruins, coated in leaves an dirt like someone recently exhumed from a shallow grave. Her head is twisted at an unnatural angle on a broken nec Our girl GASPS and scrambles to her feet, fleeing. Only to stop dead in her tracks as she nearly collides wi

She reels away in horror, forced to take the long way bac the Oldsmobile. She runs the last few yards to the car wh we can hear the eerie sound of STATIC emanating from the radio as she hurls herself -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside.   Safe! She sits there, out of breath. She glances over quickly a our guy, gravely pale, slumped unconscious behind the steering wheel. She chafes her hands to get the circulation going again. She turns down the volume on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chattering teeth)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - I did it - got through - but I don't know how much she understood - the operator I mean - He doesn't respond. GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: - Just have to hope - maybe - they can trace the line - When this too gets no response from him she looks over, frowning. She scoots a little closer across the front sea toward him. Which is when WE SEE -

dialogues.speaker: HIS GHOST
dialogues.text: standing outside the car, slack-expressioned and staring. He stands there a beat, then drifts off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hang in there, can't be much longer... She reaches to jostle him awake.    One touch confirms he worst fears. She reaches up to switch on the INTERIOR LIGHT, to get a better look at him. GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh god! Her reaction is so sudden and violent and overwhelming it seems for a moment she's going to be sick. She covers her mouth, muffling a cry of raw-throated terror. Then shakes him again, harder this time, desperate to wak him. GIRL (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! Please! Don't leave me alone! Tears spill down her cheeks as she fights hysteria. She shakes him harder. His inert body spills to one side, slumping against her. Her grief turns to something else, instinctive and immedi revulsion, at the feel of his cold dead weight against he She scrambles across the front seat to put as much distan as she can between herself and the corpse. Cowers against the passenger door. The INTERIOR LIGHT flickers out as the battery finally di

dialogues.text: The door opens and she backs out, hauling the dead body a her. Her face is red, tear-streaked. GIRL (crying)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry... sorry... I'm sorry... She strains to move his dead weight. Her feet slip on the ice and she lets go of him, catching herself on the open door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                   8

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She grabs the body under the armpits, hauls with all her strength. Drags him a few yards away from the Oldsmobile. His boot heels ploughing twin gouges in the snow. Behind her, gravity pulls the heavy car door shut with a THUNK. Suddenly her feet go out from under her as she hits a pat of ice. She goes down hard on her ass, sprawling. Sits there a beat, as- HEADLIGHTS appear on the dark horizon.   We see them a sp second before she does... He's coming. When she glimpses the oncoming headlights out of the corn of her eye she turns her head slowly in their direction, for an instant it almost seems as if they don't register. Then her eyes widen in terror, she lets out a small whimp and leaps into action. She scrambles to her feet and makes a mad dash toward the Oldsmobile - Only to find when she tugs on the handle that it's STUCK. She yanks on it harder, getting frantic now, as - The HEADLIGHTS get brighter, bearing down, close enough n that we can hear the ROAR of the oncoming engine. She kicks the handle, tugs with all her might, rocking th car but not succeeding in getting the door open. As the headlights become BLINDING... Suddenly there's the sound of BRAKES being engaged, and t headlights slow to a stop just a few yards shy of where s standing in the middle of the road. She shields her eyes with an upraised hand. It's a SNOWPLOW. The SNOWPLOW DRIVER, 50s, sticks his head out the window. SNOWPLOW DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kids okay? She's too stunned to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.text: The snowplow driver is a hale townie dressed like a high school principal on a hunting trip. He and our girl transfer our guy's lifeless body to the B SEAT of the snowplow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the cab it's blessedly warm. The dashboard panel, and CB radio are lit up like a Christmas tree. While the snowplow driver tests the front tire chains, ou girl checks on our guy's body. The snowplow driver climbs up behind the wheel, gives her sympathetic look. Picks up the C.B. microphone. SNOWPLOW DRIVER (to C.B.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dispatch, come in... DISPATCH (RADIO)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead... SNOWPLOW DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm out at the site of that reported accident on 606. One of them didn't make it. I'm taking the other directly to the trauma unit in Hadleyville.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Copy that. The driver puts the snowplow in gear and sets off driving Her eyes cut to the-

dialogues.speaker: SIDEVIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: Where she sees the STRANDED OLDSMOBILE receding in the distance. WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snowplow cruises along, its plow blade throwing twin white rooster's tails of ice and snow to either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares blankly out the window at the snow swirling in headlights. The snowplow driver makes small-talk to help pass the tim SNOWPLOW DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been some real bad accidents on this road over the years. When I was growing up, there was a family from New York City found out here froze solid-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three blue CORPSES sit in the car: mother, father, infant Their gaping mouths frozen open in a silent rictus scream

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snowplow driver shakes his head at the eerie memory. SNOWPLOW DRIVER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... fire department had to hose them down with hot water for two hours to thaw them out. I remember back in high school there was a stupid rumor going around if you went driving out here on moonless nights and looked up in your rearview, you might see the dead baby in your backseat ... She frowns at this, reminded of her earlier vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about those ruins up on the hill? The retirement home for old priests?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tragic story. Winter of `61 they were all found froze to death in their beds...

dialogues.text: ELDERLEY PRIESTS lie motionless in their beds, FACES froz in blue rictus deathmasks.

dialogues.text: Must've been a pilot on the boiler went out, or something...

dialogues.text: CLOSE ON our girl, processing this. She has her suspicion the truth isn't as simple as a pilot light blowing out. SNOWPLOW DRIVER (cont'd) Actually, there's no big mystery why this is such a bad stretch of road for motorists. You got low- lying fog that gets trapped in the valley, reduces visibility to-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then BRIGHT HEADLIGHTS appear out of the pre-dawn gl SNOWPLOW DRIVER (cont'd) Who in the hell is out driving in this mess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He scowls, raising a meaty hand to shield his eyes. A dread look of dj vu crosses our girl's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She knows. SNOWPLOW DRIVER (cont'd) Must be Tom McClintic. Only fellow I know who lives way out here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for the C.B. mike, thumbs the switch. SNOWPLOW DRIVER (cont'd) (into microphone) Tom, is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not Tom...

dialogues.text: And as the ONCOMING HEADLIGHTS OF THE HIGHWAY PATROLMAN g brighter, she calmly buckles her seatbelt.

dialogues.text: The ONCOMING CAR roars down the middle of the pickup's la the distance between the speeding vehicles closing fast. game of chicken is fast approaching the point of no retur

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They watch the ONCOMING HEADLIGHTS.

dialogues.text: Doesn't this stupid son of a gun realize we're bigger than him?! No way he's going to win this fight!

dialogues.text: Hang on, officer, I'm coming... Then he begins to make his way down.

dialogues.text: No!!! She unbuckles her seatbelt, throws open the passenger doo exits. WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05                  93

dialogues.text: The instant she sets foot outside she stops dead, the blo rushing from her face and her eyes going wide in disbelie PAN 360-DEGREES to reveal a landscape she knows all-too-w The stranded `88 Oldsmobile. dialogues.text: (calling down)

dialogues.text: Wait! Don't go down there! Stop! Suddenly the snowy leaves gives way under her and she SLI Lands hard and SLIDES the rest of the way down on her ass

The snowplow driver calls to the TRAPPED HIGHWAY PATROLMA

dialogues.text: Hang on, officer! We'll get you out! She catches his arm to stop him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WIND CHILL - Yellow Revisions 2/23/05

dialogues.text: No!!! Don't go near it!!!

dialogues.text: What!!? We have to get him out of there... Smoke rises from the car's gas tank, a small FIRE burning

dialogues.text: What are you waiting for, a letter from the Bishop? Suddenly it dawns on our girl that he isn't talking to th Also that they aren't alone. Widen to reveal - A DOZEN ELDERLY PRIESTS in black winter coats and fedoras standing all around them on the snowy embankment, faces g
